website_summaries.verdict: An affordable, entry-level yogurt maker with few accessories.
pros: Includes glass jars and a clear dome for easy visual inspection

customer_reviews.title: Fire hazard, it melted!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make yogurt,and it worked okay the first few times but I noticed how hot the maker was getting on the underside. I would end up putting it on a cutting board so it didn't melt the counter, after it left some brown scorch marks. After that I put it away and got it out the other day to give it another try and right before bed I decided to put a board under it. I smelt something melting, picked it up and to my horror it had melted! The yogurt maker had melted itself. If I had gone to bed and left it i'm afraid there may have been a fire. This thing is dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: trevor

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: My mom has a Greek yogurt maker made by Dash. I prefer hers because it has one big container instead of the small jars, and it strains the whey to make thicker yogurt. This one by Epica, I like because it's cheaper and has glass jars. I used a ladle to fill the jars, next time I'm going to pour straight from my Pyrex measuring cups and maybe I won't spill as much. I used whole milk and Stonyfield plain yogurt. Works well, just make sure you whisk the yogurt into the milk really well otherwise it will be lumpy. So far I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Marie

customer_reviews.title: I loved this the first 2 times I used it
customer_reviews.text: I loved this the first 2 times I used it. Then the 3rd time the finished product didn't taste like yogurt. The 4th time I used it I took the temperature with an instant read food thermometer and the temperature was over130° which is 10° too hot, and hot enough to kill the cultures. I asked to return the unit,and was sent a return sticker, but I had to pay the postage, which was the same as the unit cost in the first place. I would have been better off throwing out the defective unit and buying another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Worked beautifully
customer_reviews.text: There's a lot of negative reviews for yogurt makers- but if you follow directions to a T you'll make gorgeous silky yogurt in your Epica too. I swear it came out like a yogurt mousse- it's divine. I was amazed it worked out for me on the first try. Boiled milk, let it cool to 110 degrees, mixed 1 cup cooled milk to my 6oz of plain yogurt starter, mixed that into the rest of the milk, filled my jars, set it for 7 hours and Taadaa! Yogurt!
customer_reviews.author: ColliNyxie

customer_reviews.title: A great little yogurt machine
customer_reviews.text: I just made my first batch of yogurt using 2% organic milk and it worked really well. I followed directions on the starter packet I bought (), filled in the glass containers and set it to go overnight for about 8.5 hours. In the morning I had delicious yogurt. It's a little thinner in consistency than the store-bought kind but that was expected and fine with me. I pre-heated my milk and let it cool down to room temp before I dissolved the starter and that's supposed to help with getting a thicker consistency. I love how I can control the quality of ingredients and don't need to worry about additional additives or sugar. Will definitely be making more batches!
customer_reviews.author: Lu2727

customer_reviews.title: One year later still happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've had the yogurt maker for a year now, and use it about once a week. Love the glass jars, although the lids are getting a bit loose. It works really well, now overheating or other problems. Now that I moved on to working with more complex starter cultures, I wish I had a unit that had controllable temperature setting. But for the price, this is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Hase

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought years ago
customer_reviews.text: No more store bought yogurt! It's so easy to use, I make a batch every 4 days. I only make plain, which is less tart than the store bought. Using organic milk, I estimate each serving is around $.50. When you pre-boil the milk(I basically heat it in the microwave and let it cool to 110) the yogurt is thick, like Greek yogurt.
customer_reviews.author: Judy D'O

customer_reviews.title: Lids aren't very tight
customer_reviews.text: Just made my first batch of non-dairy yogurt and it really works! My son has a dairy allergy and this was super easy to use in order to get healthy, low sugar, dairy-free yogurt. There is no temperature settings, just turn it on and go. The jars are quality glass. The only negative is that the lids don't screw on very tight and I've already had a spill in the refrigerator.
customer_reviews.author: Ali B

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised to use Nut Milks
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving this 3 stars because of the way it was advertised that you could make yogurt with Almond Milk. I attempted 3 tries and the company even sent me there recipe since it wouldn't work, and that was no different. I was able to make regular yogurt with whole milk, but I'm allergic to milk and bought this thinking the Almond Milk would work as advertised. If you don't plan to make the yogurt with whole milk, then don't buy it, it won't work. At least it didn't for me. So I'm out the cost, because its not worth trying to send back.
customer_reviews.author: PKathy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Basic Yogurt Maker
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little yogurt maker-- and an addition to the one we already have so we could make double batches -- no bells-and-whistles, but honestly I've never needed that with a yogurt maker. Wasn't a fan of the starter, but used it in the first batch. The yogurt was okay - tasted fine, but I like the texture of the yogurt I make using another yogurt as starter so I'm sticking to that. I also fill the jars full when using my own starter rather than just the 3.5 oz the insert recommended. They turn out fine, every time. If you don't need all the additional stuff (timer, etc.) this will work fine for you.
customer_reviews.author: RWP

customer_reviews.title: We have loved this! Works great and make yummy yogurt
customer_reviews.text: We have loved this! Works great and make yummy yogurt. For some reason from the picture I thought the glass containers would be larger, they are not. Each glass container is 1 serving, so if you are wanting to make bunches of yogurt like my SCD friends this might not be the size you are looking for. If not, this one is great! easy to clean as well.
customer_reviews.author: hbdharper

customer_reviews.title: These can be used for many things in addition to making yogurt...
customer_reviews.text: If you stop using your yogurt maker (I did,) do NOT throw it away. You can use it as a seed starter (plug it in put small pots in and mist daily,) or even a biscuit warmer. I am going to use mine in my back yard to keep biscuits or croissants warm for example. I have heard tell you can also ferment home made sake in them. Or small batches of sauerkraut.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Sands

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine, happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Everything i expected works just fine, saves on time and energy. I have been using previous batches of yogurt for my cultures so i have not used the packet it came with. I have also been cooking the milk before i put it in the machine at 180 then dropping it to 118 and putting in my culture then adding it to the machine in a bowl not the small glass jars.I have not tried any of the recipes in the book. but the machine is easy to use and very basic!
customer_reviews.author: Radfordshorty

customer_reviews.title: perfect for plant-based yogurt making!
customer_reviews.text: I use this yogurt to make soy yogurt (no animal products here!). Soy milk doesn't naturally thicken, so I used the required amount of original soy milk, added 4 tablespoons of corn starch and boiled it till it was thickened. Then added 3 probiotic capsules, stirred it and placed it in my new Epica Yogurt Maker. The yogurt came out so delicious and fresh tasting. I'll never buy that expensive, watery stuff from the store again.
customer_reviews.author: Linz

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good yogurt maker
customer_reviews.text: Good price. It works fine but my yoghurt keeps turning out sort of runny. Seems to cook at a slightly high temperature. The only negative is the jars are curved so are difficult to clean. My previous yogurt maker jars had straight sides which were better. Otherwise it's a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret P.

customer_reviews.title: A keeper with great Customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I'm a brand new yogurt maker and have NO idea what is the proper way to do this! Customer service from EPICA sent an email recipe for yogurt, and a telephone number to call if I had problems! WOW! Loved that! First batch I used the enclosed yogurt culture and produced a soft creamy batch of yogurt! Glasses and covers fit right into dishwasher, so no work!
customer_reviews.author: Babs

customer_reviews.title: Amazing deal for an amazing price!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for over a year, and it has always provided delicious yogurt. Granted, it doesn't take a rocket-scientist to make yogurt, but having the proper incubation temperature is essential. I bought extra jars from the get-go, which allows you flexibility when going from one batch to the next. For the money, this is an incredible deal, and you can't go wrong with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: PorcupineMom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price for a great product!
customer_reviews.text: This yogurt maker is so easy! I just use the last container to make the next batch. Since I prefer my yogurt firm and very tart, I have been setting this up before bed, and in the morning, the yogurt is perfect. I am extremely happy with this well-priced yogurt maker. Also, I have received 2 emails from the Epica company, checking on my satisfaction with their product. That kind of customer service is almost unheard of these days. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: moleroja

customer_reviews.title: If you want to a non-milk yogurt, buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Go to Whole Paycheck and you pay a fortune for a good non-milk yogurt. We use coconut milk/almond milk. The customer service was very supportive in giving us precise guidelines on making yogurt without milk. This is a really good product, easy to use and you'll save a bunch of money.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gardel

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this yogurt maker. I have been using it for a couple months now, making a batch once a week. Recently the jar in the center comes out mostly liquid, while the jars around the edge are perfect. I am assuming the center is where the heating element is. Instead of getting 7 jars I have 6 edible jars and I am fine with that. I use skim raw milk and it is the best yogurt I have ever eaten! I also use the yogourmet starter because it is soo easy to use. Happy!!
customer_reviews.author: C Toth

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I love this appliance. One of my friends told me how easy it was to make yogurt. I never believed it. So I bought this appliance and it is so easy and good. You can vary the recipe from full fat/whole milk to skim milk/fat free type yogurt. Trally easy ....Just follow the directions.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi-OV

customer_reviews.title: Good Epica Yogurt Maker
customer_reviews.text: I like the Epica Yogurt Maker and plan to recommend to my friends and relative. Everytime I make yogurt I normally make more than 7 jars, probably 14 jars and if I buy another one that would take too much space on my counter.. So I use the oven method instead, which is slower than your Yogurt maker. But over all the product is super...Automatic shutoff would be helpful but I don't need it at this stage because I have to taste the yogurt before turning if off. I made yogurt 5 times already, every single time it turns out sucessfully.
customer_reviews.author: Simi Valley, CA Resident

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I used the yogurt maker for the first time and I absolutely love the result. The machine is very easy to use (the booklet provides easy to understand explanations on how to use the yogurt maker and even provide some recipes). I let the yogurt for 11 hours and the result was amazing! I am a big yogurt fan (and do not like too much the yogurt you find in supermarkets..) so I am excited that this machine works so well! Plus, it is much cheaper than buying good yogurt in a store. I highly recommend it !
customer_reviews.author: Nath

customer_reviews.title: organic food
customer_reviews.text: One batch made. I love it. Affected by the many chemicals now added to food, I had to find something like this. Since buying it, I have made many batches. I used powdered goat milk, and cow milk. Both turned out well. I just bought one for my daughter. I liked the glass jars. Plastic so dangerous now.
customer_reviews.author: junebug

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: It works. I would rather not have the tiny individual cups though, but rather one large container. i like that i can use the tray as a warmer for other things.
customer_reviews.author: Ceasar McChicken

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase. I was so happy with the first one, I bought this one to gift to a friend. I make my yogurt with half and half and a small amount of sugar and it always comes out fabulously rich and creamy. Better than any store-bought Greek yogurt. Add fresh or frozen (thawed) fruit (or a spoon of jam if you have nothing else) and you can't go wrong. Cute jars, too!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little machine. It is compact and uncomplicated. Easy to use and makes great yogurt. Just as good as the more expensive ones. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Menchu

customer_reviews.title: ... have all ready used it and am having really good yogurt made from it using the directions supplied with ...
customer_reviews.text: I have all ready used it and am having really good yogurt made from it using the directions supplied with the unit. Very easy to use and very easy to clean. am completely satisfied with it and would recommend it to anyone, frequent yogurt maker or novice. Thank you for recommending on your website.
customer_reviews.author: B. Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and affordable!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous little unit at a wonderful price. I did not use the starter provided as it has skim milk powder included. I am lactose intolerant so I used an organic store-bought lactose-free yogurt along with organic lactose-free whole milk and turned out an exceptional batch of yogurt. From here on out, my imagination is my only limitation with what I can make with this little unit. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Skunk the Cat

customer_reviews.title: Update
customer_reviews.text: I'm still using the yogurt maker and it still works, but I now need a jar and the company is no longer selling them. I've asked for their suggestion for an alternative, but I would definitely not buy this now if I knew that the glass jars were not replaceable. The jar that needs replacing has an internal crack. I've been careful with them and don't know how it happened, but glass does break. So if you have this yogurt maker be extra careful! And if anyone has a suggestion for a jar that will fit that space, please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: I'm a Noob but this is fool-proof.
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous to actually use this thing after I bought it because I was sure I would screw it up somehow and my yogurt wouldn't set or would taste bad. So far I only tried the culture that came in the box with some low fat milk, and it set up perfectly and tastes just like it should. I used a deep fry/candy thermometer to see the temp while I was heating the milk and then I left the machine on over night (slightly longer than the time recommended)--everything's great. Easy-Peasy for a yogurt newbie like me.
customer_reviews.author: magurkis

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this product! It's straightforward and easy to use. My only frustration is in finding replacement jars to use in the maker. I have 2 small children and with the 7 jars, we can go through a batch of yogurt in 2 days. I would like a back up set of jars to make a second batch so I don't run out! I've been looking online and can't seem to find them.... I've tried a pyrex bowl and with the size of the maker, the dimensions on the bowl have be perfect for it to fit. So my search continues! Other than that, I love this little gadget!
customer_reviews.author: Stacie

customer_reviews.title: Tons of effort for little results - thick milk was the result
customer_reviews.text: I've tried making yogurt 3 times using this device. Unfortunately each time the yogurt never really set. I have made all the recommended adjustments in the process but still ended up with mostly thick milk.
customer_reviews.author: Catie Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Nothing fancy, but it works very well
customer_reviews.text: Epica Homemade Organic "Set and Go" Electric yogurt maker is simple but effective. Construction and material quaility is very good. The jars provided are rather thin however, so you must be careful (a replacement is available but not exactly cheap). The maker does what it's designed to do and does it well. A good value overall.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Good little yogurt maker
customer_reviews.text: This little machine does exactly what it is supposed to and I would buy it again but hope I won't have to! The price is right the suggested timing was just right.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lou C

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to operate.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with this machine; it makes great yogurt, and I love that I know exactly what's in it.
customer_reviews.author: fil

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. Invest in a better one.
customer_reviews.text: Made my first batch of yogurt and this machine runs too hot and curdled all my yogurt. I took the temp and it was about 125 degrees. Bye bye probiotics! What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love making my own yogurt. It is not full of things I can't spell or pronounce.
customer_reviews.author: donna wasserburger

customer_reviews.title: Yogurt Turned Out Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Making yogurt couldn't be any easier. Once everything's all mixed and ready to go, just divvy it up between the seven single-serving-sized glass containers, put them in the yogurt maker, and turn it on. Several hours later, you have yogurt. Just put the lids on the jars and keep them in the fridge until you're ready to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R

customer_reviews.title: Terrific yogurt maker - works well using non-dairy coconut milk, too!
customer_reviews.text: I've never made homemade yogurt, so this was my first experience. I need to use coconut milk due to my problems digesting dairy products. I contacted the company for instructions on how to make yogurt using coconut milk and received a very prompt and courteous reply, complete with instructions and a recipe. Following these instructions, I had very positive results. The machine is very easy to use, and the clean-up is easy. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: jj322

customer_reviews.title: Easy, delicious whether the milk is boiled or not
customer_reviews.text: Easy,delicious whether the milk is boiled or not. I'm wondering if I can get a second set of jars, so that I can make it ahead, rather than waiting until I use the last jar. I'm letting it stay in the maker 24 hours, follow the SCD and Gaps diet directions.
customer_reviews.author: Ellyn Jeck

customer_reviews.title: ... have ever used and my first batch turned out beautifully. The directions that come with the yogurt maker ...
customer_reviews.text: This Epica yogurt maker is the first one I have ever used and my first batch turned out beautifully. The directions that come with the yogurt maker are interesting and not easy to use as the steps are split and on the first and last page. Once I found them all we were off and running. For a first time user who does not have to depend on an alarm or auto shutoff option this item works nicely. If you can't pay attention to the time there might be a problem here as there is no timer or auto shut off. For me that is okay. This is a good item for a beginner like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Margie Trammell

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: made my first batch and it turned out great. very time consuming but that is the price you have to pay. plan on using it again and again. maybe next time i will put in some fruit.
customer_reviews.author: Evette

customer_reviews.title: wouldn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get it to make yogurt! I tried it 5 times using various methods. The temperature isn't steady and hot enough. just use your oven
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: ... new yogurt maker and it has been working out great. I am able to use organic milk and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have made yogurt three times now with my new yogurt maker and it has been working out great. I am able to use organic milk and because I control what is added or not added I can better know what my kids and I are eating. I really like that. I used the starter that came with the yogurt maker and it tasted great. Next we are going to try using some other starters just to see the different results. Overall I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: carla pietrofeso-harsanyi

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to follow the instructions
customer_reviews.text: I just used my yogurt maker for the first time. It was easy to follow the instructions. I did not boil the milk, but added the dried powdered milk as instructed for the thicker type "Greek" yogurt. It turned out just fine....just takes several hours longer, but I had it on overnight, and it was finished in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: LMB

customer_reviews.title: Replaced a twenty year old yogurt maker and am so pleased with the difference
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly! Replaced a twenty year old yogurt maker and am so pleased with the difference. Made yogurt in just 5 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: As good customer service as you will find !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little inexpensive yogurt maker. I am very impressed. Works great and makes yogurt making very inexpensive. Although this is a great little machine, I am even more impressed with the customer service. By the time I had used it 2 times and I had gotten an email from customer support of Epica about how it is working. If I had any problems with it and some tips on how to do some variations. Their customer service is as good as it gets. I wish all companies operated according to Epica policy. VERY PLEASED WITH MY PURCHASE!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JTS

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a low carber, so I used 50% half and half and 50% whole milk to make my yogurt (fat's my friend). The yogurt was DELICIOUS! Thick, creamy, perfect, and costs about $2 less a cup than the organic whole milk and cream yogurt I was buying. The Epica pretty much paid for itself after one batch.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Plummer

customer_reviews.title: good results! I used non-fat organic milk
customer_reviews.text: Simple, effective, good results! I used non-fat organic milk, heated it up, cooled it down, and I added the packet of starter that came with the machine and some fresh organic yogurt as well. In 11 hrs. the result was a wonderful thick yogurt. I agree that the lids are a little challenging to put on, but the jars are cute. All in all I'm completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: So much better than buying yogurt!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, works great! I only make vegan yogurt and it's perfect for that. Comes with easy to follow instructions/recipe. Easy to clean and use. I like the size of the jars, too and how much yogurt I can make at once. I'd say my only complaint is that the lids don't twist on very smoothly, but it's not much of an issue. It's hard to find vegan yogurt in my town so this is saving me a lot of money plus less waste with making your own than buying premade in plastic containers. Great deal on this yogurt maker as well!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: This yogurt maker makes it really easy.
customer_reviews.text: Made my first batch of yogurt last weekend. It came out really well. This yogurt maker makes it really easy.
customer_reviews.author: Katsmom

customer_reviews.title: This is an easy system to use
customer_reviews.text: I made yogurt with the Epica set the first time, and got very well-textured and creamy yogurt on the first try. I used starter from a whole milk yogurt. I have been making yogurt for several years. This is an easy system to use. The system kept the yogurt warm enough to keep "working" for the whole 12 hours. Some I have used did not maintain a consistent temperature, this one did. I would give it 5 stars if the system allowed me to make a little bit more yogurt at once.
customer_reviews.author: peggy gaboury

customer_reviews.title: All in all a pretty decent yogurt maker for the price
customer_reviews.text: All in all a pretty decent yogurt maker for the price. I would've liked having a temperature control adjuster. The yogurt turned out pretty good but I could never get it the right consistency that I wanted
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Paige Tate

customer_reviews.title: The price is a very good bargain. I've made yogurt for years and this ...
customer_reviews.text: The product was shipped in a timely manner. The price is a very good bargain. I've made yogurt for years and this product is an improvement on my previous yogurt maker because the containers are glass. I followed the directions, used the starter included with the maker, and I now have seven delicious yogurts to use in our morning smoothies. Perfect. Delighted. Next time I am going to use one of the yogurts to "start" the next batch and see how that goes.
customer_reviews.author: Tazz

customer_reviews.title: I think my son likes it better than the commercial kind
customer_reviews.text: I've made soy yogurt, technically cultured soymilk, for my son who is allergic to dairy. I think my son likes it better than the commercial kind. It's also a huge cost savings compared to buying soy yogurt. I like the small jars that make individual servings. Also it's the perfect batch size. I only need 3.5 cups of milk. I would like to know if I could get another set of jars, however. The directions could be better as it seems like they were not proofread. One place says the lids can go in the dishwasher another place says they can't.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Boge

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This yogurt maker comes with a very competitive tag price. Easy to use and gets the job done. Plus the vendor followed up after the purchase and it was a nice touch. I gave it 4 stars because the description set and go makes it seem the heating portion would have some kind of timer. It doesn't so you have to remember when to turn it off (no biggie). The other small improvement is about the jar. The lids are not dishwasher safe... Really? Other than that I'm happy
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Good product, price and customer support
customer_reviews.text: Good product, price and customer support. Liked the starter culture included with the maker, it came out thinner than supermarket yogurt but much more flavor, very tart. Also tried starting from trader joe's yogurt which came out thicker but very bland. I don't have much experience yet making yogurt but I can say this is a solid product and if you have a little extra time, very rewarding.
customer_reviews.author: Tobe H.

customer_reviews.title: So glad I found this and I can't believe the price.
customer_reviews.text: I want sure how I would like homemade yogurt. I read that it doesn't taste like what you get in the grocery store. I added honey to sweeten and it was delicious. Super easy to make. Glad jars are perfect serving size. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Epica Electric Yogurt Maker from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I love my Epica Electric Yogurt Maker. I was able to make yogurt without added sugar or sweetener. I had been looking for some since my husband is a diabetic and all yogurt I could find had sugar. Now I can make my own in whatever flavor I want it.
customer_reviews.author: Nellie Vice

customer_reviews.title: I am only giving it three stars as I don't like having to use the small bottles
customer_reviews.text: This is the first yogurt maker I have ever purchased or used. I am only giving it three stars as I don't like having to use the small bottles. I am using the yogurt maker today with a glass bowl inside. I think the maker would be better and more simplistic with just having one container to make the yogurt in. I suppose if you want to flavor each individual jar then it may be a better fit. As for me and my large family I really would like one container for all of it. Less clean up and easier to use. Other than that it did make great tasting yogurt.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Peck

customer_reviews.title: It is as described but there is no light to ...
customer_reviews.text: It is as described but there is no light to check whether it is getting warm or not. I had to wait for 2 hours to check that the machine really works. Otherwise all right, I have used it for three times till now
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: pretty simple to use
customer_reviews.text: All in all, pretty simple to use. The end result tastes MUCH better than store bought yogurt - most of which has added gelatin or other thickeners. Processed the yogurt for 8 hours and refrigerated overnight - delicious. Only negative comment would be that the containers would be nicer if they held a little bit more product.
customer_reviews.author: cojoification

customer_reviews.title: I am not sure I can recommend this yogurt maker
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure I can recommend this yogurt maker. I have made a couple batches, and the middle jar doesn't set and is far warmer than the other jars at the end of the processing time. It's possible the heat in the middle is killing the culture and making that particular jar useless. It won't stop me from using the machine, but if it happens again, I'll fill that jar with water to avoid wasting the ingredients. I'll update if the next batch turns out differently.....
customer_reviews.author: heather hyatt

customer_reviews.title: 409% YOGURT
customer_reviews.text: My mom freaking loves it. She's made yogurt everyday since we got it and there's yogurt everywhere. How the yogurt tastes depends on your own recipe but it does incubate it to the correct texture and doneness. And it's 20 bucks so just get it.
customer_reviews.author: Avon

customer_reviews.title: Simple (no need to heat milk) tasty yogurt overnight.
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as it is supposed to (i.e. keeps low steady heat at the right temp for yogurt cultures to thrive). One thing that has kept me from making yogurt at home in the past is the need to scald the milk first - just one step too many I thought. However, this yogurt maker claims you do not need to heat it, as long as the milk is pasteurized. So, I tried it (using 1/2 whole milk and 1/2 2% milk, with 6oz of plain commercial yogurt) and in 10 hours had very tangy, creamy yogurt.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy K

customer_reviews.title: Good product but yogurt containers too small
customer_reviews.text: This works really well, but the yogurt containers themselves are tiny and you can't wash the lids in the dishwasher. I wish the containers were 6 or 8 oz. rather than 4 oz.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have been very pleased with how well this product works. I used commercial plain yogurt for my first starter (as described in the enclosed booklet). I have already made six batches and all have turned out well. This gives me six jars to eat and the seventh as a starter for the next batch.
customer_reviews.author: Jed

customer_reviews.title: everything easy to follow and an easy clean up
customer_reviews.text: I made my first batch of yogurt 2 days ago and found the yogurt maker just right for my needs. It was simple and straight forward, no elaborate instructions, everything easy to follow and an easy clean up. My product came out perfect. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Walker

customer_reviews.title: The yogurt maker works great with milk
customer_reviews.text: received it in record time. Trying to make coconut milk yogurt and having trouble. The yogurt maker works great with milk, but I can't have that. I must continue tweaking to get it right.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Best yogurt ever!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! It comes with easy-to-follow instructions and ideas for recipe variations to try with your yogurts. We add extra nonfat dry milk for a thicker consistency and more calcium, and the result surpasses even my favorites among the elite-brand store-bought yogurts. Best yogurt ever! Fast. Easy. Fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Christa Brown

customer_reviews.title: This is as described.
customer_reviews.text: This is as described. Just remember it is an incubator and there is no automatic timer to shut it of
customer_reviews.author: les nicoll

customer_reviews.title: One of my best purchases on Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: I make yogurt once a week in this. It is so easy.
customer_reviews.author: SWENCILER

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! It works beautifully, and the glass jars are terrific and easy to clean. Instructions are very clear. This product arrived on time and in perfect condition. A great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Its a Good Buy-Go Ahead and Get One!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this yogurt maker. It arrived quickly, was well packaged and so far it has been working great. We are on our 5th or 6th batch already and I am happy with the quality of it. I wasn't even shopping for a yogurt maker, I just happened across it. For the price I thought I would try it, since we go through a lot of yogurt. Saves a lot of those plastic cups in the landfill, and I know exactly what is in the yogurt I make this way.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene

customer_reviews.title: Very good product! I have been using this yogurt maker ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good product! I have been using this yogurt maker for several months, it makes great yogurt, and the instructional/recipe booklet is very helpful. The only thing that can be frustrating is the lids to the jars snap and twist on rather than just twist on like typical jar lids do. This method takes more time and can lead to spills. This yogurt maker would also be handy if it came with one large bowl to make a larger amount of yogurt at one time.
customer_reviews.author: raindance13

customer_reviews.title: Good basic unit
customer_reviews.text: Made my first batch using the instructions that came with the unit. Didn't preheat the Milk and it Turned out well. Very good for a basic unit.
customer_reviews.author: W. Gamble

customer_reviews.title: My first homemade yogurt was delicious.
customer_reviews.text: Epica yogurt maker is not only sleek and nicely fitted to my kitchen counter, it also has a pouch of freeze-dried culture starter included. So I gave it a try last weekend and the result was a success. Not to mention that the glass jars are beautiful to look at and felt good to get hold of.
customer_reviews.author: Chi Chen

customer_reviews.title: dig it
customer_reviews.text: dig it. I've only used it once right now but it's a pretty straight forward process and machine: heat the milk close to boiling, cool it to 110 degrees, mix it with culture and poor into jars, turn on and wait about 8 - 9 hours. does its job, simple and straight forward, and I love that the jars are glass and not plastic
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The yogurt maker works well. My main issue is locating replacement jars at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic! I use it to make vegan yogurt and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic! I use it to make vegan yogurt and love it!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Davis

customer_reviews.title: EZ yogurt
customer_reviews.text: I have only had it for a couple of weeks and made 4 batches of soy-yogurt. It's as easy as it can get. Mix 1 quart soy-milk with half a yogurt from a previous batch (first time I used commercial from Stonyfield), pour it in the containers and the next morning is ready.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Catalano

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gift choice for yogurt lovers on my Christmas list. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: cindy62

customer_reviews.title: quick now
customer_reviews.text: easy to use don't need to wait over night anymore. simple to use, just boil the milk first, that will give you a sweet, other the test is sour.
customer_reviews.author: Xu, ZhiQiang

customer_reviews.title: Yogurt tastes much better than store bought
customer_reviews.text: I have used it four times and have been successful each time. I use soy milk and for a starter I've used some of a previous batch or used a small container of a store bought brand. Only problem, the package of starter sent said to use 42 ounces of milk and the instruction leaflet said 28 ounces. I went with the leaflet. Yogurt tastes much better than store bought.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Field

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and makes great yogurt
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and makes great yogurt. I keep one pot back to use as a starter culture for the new batch.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: and not too bad on the eyes
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and functional, and not too bad on the eyes. it's small enough that i hardly notice it in my kitchen. Im very happy with this product, worth every penny considering I use it twice a week.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: The yogurt maker is working just fine. I've been making coconut yogurt and cashew milk ...
customer_reviews.text: The yogurt maker is working just fine. I've been making coconut yogurt and cashew milk yogurt for a week with no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Musicmomie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: yummy yogurt. Made almond milk yogurt. It didn't make as much as I thought it would after skimming out the whey. Tasted great!thanks
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Agar

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Yogurt Maker
customer_reviews.text: I love making my own yogurt and it is so simple! Very happy to not be buying a carton each week! The maker is easy to use, the jars clean easily, and the price is so right!
customer_reviews.author: Violetpetal

customer_reviews.title: The yogurt made is far from being good. It does not seem to have any temperature ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this yogurt maker but I have being struggling trying to make work. The temperature stabilises at 127 F, which is too high. The yogurt made is far from being good. It does not seem to have any temperature control.
customer_reviews.author: JAB88

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Now I can have home made yogurt everyday
customer_reviews.author: D. YEUNG

customer_reviews.title: good experience with this seller
customer_reviews.text: Item as described, good experience with this seller, makes great yougurt
customer_reviews.author: M. Currier

customer_reviews.title: Make your own yogurt without fuss
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly the first time I used it - instructions were clear and they included a starter packet so I was able to use it right away. I eat the yogurt plain its so good - cured it for 12 hours.
customer_reviews.author: debaney

customer_reviews.title: This is a great yogurt maker
customer_reviews.text: This is a great yogurt maker. It is the least expensive on Amazon but does a great job. I bought one for myself and have been using it very regularly. I then bought one for my sister, and my friend also bought one after she saw mine. Extremely easy to use. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica D.

customer_reviews.title: Great yogurt maker!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. It does not have an automatic timer or shut off, but I knew that before I ordered it. Fast shipping! And I love the little glass jars.
customer_reviews.author: Chris in FL

customer_reviews.title: Do Your Research
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this item is fine... I've not figured out how to make non-dairy yogurt. First attempt was a dismal failure despite having looked the recipe up online. Almost took this item to the secondhand store, but decided to give it another go before I give up on yogurt making.
customer_reviews.author: kayeor1963

customer_reviews.title: Yogurt maker happiness
customer_reviews.text: My friend has one. It's the only way to have healthy yogurt these days. I am very pleased that i received my item promptly and the service behind my product is awesome! I can't wait to use this Christmas present I bought for my grandson to give me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. The unit makes enough for about a week but does not require much storage space when not in use. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon G

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to use following the directions
customer_reviews.text: Very simple but effective design. It is easy to use following the directions, I had never made yogurt before, but I was making near perfect yogurt right from the start. Easy and simple to clean glass containers with well fitting, strong plastic lids, Excellent value for money.
customer_reviews.author: stephen halliwell

product_meta.title: Epica Homemade Organic “Set and Go” Electric Yogurt Maker with Seven, 6 oz. Dishwasher-Safe Glass Jars and Lids
product_meta.description:
Longing for creamy, delicious, health-infusing yogurt in all your favorite mouthwatering flavors, without the constant temping, hours of labor, scalding, burning, or curdling? 

Epica makes it easy. 

Now you can bypass the additives, preservatives and costly pricing of “organic” or “health food” yogurts, because with Epica’s top rated yogurt maker, you’ll never buy from the grocery store again. 

Epica’s health-infusing homemade yogurt maker allows you to EASILY and SAFELY… 

 Perfect for First-Time Yogurt Makers! Buy now and get the scrumptiously simple recipes that transform your milk into creamy pleasure. 

 Make all the healthy yogurt you crave, in all the flavors you love, at a fraction of the price!

 Achieve the perfect thickness, sweetness and tartness, every time. Just set the time-reminder leave your yogurt in as long as you’d like to experience optimal texture, and just go about your day. (6-12 hours)

 Design your healthiest options by making yogurt from organic or non-organic whole fat, 2%, 1% or non-fat dairy milk, almond milk, soy milk and more.

 Create a diversity of flavors guaranteed to please the whole family with unique 7-jar cooking system. 

 Guarantee your yogurt remains at the perfect, safe incubation temperature required for perfect setting, and optimal health. 

 Ends the overwhelming task of heating up milk, and checking all the different temperatures.

 

 FULL 3 Year Warranty assures you’re getting your money’s worth, and more.

 

If you want to experience the health-infusing benefits only homemade, wholesome yogurt brings to your table, without the high cost, or unhealthy additives, then Epica’s easy to use yogurt maker will be your kitchen’s new best friend. 

To order simply click Add to Cart now before it returns to backorder status
feature_bullets: DELICIOUS HOMEMADE YOGURT IS THE NATURAL CHOICE. High-fructose corn syrup? Dimethylpolysiloxane? Not in YOUR yogurt. Save hundreds of dollars a year and keep your family safe by serving your own nutritious snacks instead of buying them at the store.
MAKE THE SMOOTHEST, CREAMIEST SNACKS: Desserts for 7, fast. Enjoy orange, raspberry, or straight-from-the-jar vanilla in minutes— you’ll be proud to serve what you create with Epica.

EASY-START MANUAL GUIDES YOUR SUCCULENT CREATIONS. For first-timers we’ve included our easy-start manual and delicious 2-minute recipes. With so many choices of flavour and ingredients, you’ll have something for everyone.

USE ONLY THE BEST. Glass is naturally safer than plastic. That’s why our yogurt maker is one of the few to use 7 six-ounce glasses, which prevents chemical leakage into your yogurt. The glasses are all dishwasher safe, and the whole construction is completely BPA free.

WE PROVIDE THE BEST BUY-BACK GUARANTEE IN THE BUSINESS: We know that you are going to love your Homemade “Set And Go” Electric Yogurt Maker. Our products are guaranteed to give you 100% satisfaction in every way. Return anything purchased from us if it proves otherwise.
